span.span: Return to Headlines

p.span: Superintendent Kris Corey announced last night during the meeting of the Fairfield-Suisun Unified School Districtâ€™s Governing Board, that FSUSD will continue distance learning for students through the end of the 2019-2020 school year.

â€œI had hoped we would be able to allow students to come back to their schools in person during the last week or two of the school calendar, since our school year ends on June 12th, a bit later than most districts. This would have been a wonderful opportunity for students to reconnect and celebrate some of their schoolâ€™s end-of-year activities. Unfortunately, it seems this wonâ€™t be possible,â€ Superintendent Corey stated.

Distance learning activities have been paused, temporarily, during the regularly scheduled Spring Break, April 10th through April 17th. Distance learning will resume on April 20th. The District will be providing additional information at that time regarding grades and course completion.

span.span: High school graduation ceremonies will be either virtualized or postponed to a date when it is safe to conduct them in person. Details regarding future graduation plans will be released as the situation with COVID-19 evolves. The Governing Board approved staffâ€™s recommendation to temporarily suspend some graduation requirements. Information about senior graduation requirements can be found in the â€œVirtual Meeting for High School Seniors and Parentsâ€ section of the district website at

p.span: Parents can assist students through this challenging time by:

span.span: Accessing learning resources on the district website at

li.span: Fostering close, positive, and collaborative communication with their childâ€™s teacher
Asking their teacher for help when they need it
Establishing a regular schedule and routine for schooling
Creating opportunities to have fun with their student while learning through activities, games, simple science experiments, coding, art, and more

br.span: The FSUSD School Board expressed appreciation for Superintendent Coreyâ€™s leadership, the staffâ€™s hard work, and parentsâ€™ patience during this time. Members of the board stressed their desire that all students and parents remain closely connected to their schools through regular communication with their teachers and principals. Contact information for principals can be found on the district website under the â€œOur Schoolsâ€ menu at

p.span: Dear FSUSD Families,
Â

This is Kris Corey, Superintendent of the Fairfield-Suisun Unified School district with some important information regarding the extension of school closures, the implementation of distance learning, and the reduction of meal service locations.

The last week has presented both challenges and opportunities. Weâ€™ve been heartened to see so many people in our community stepping up to lead and volunteer.Â We appreciate everyone coming together during this time of uncertainty.
As we move into a new phase of school closures during the COVID-19 pandemic, we need to share some important updated information.

span.strong: Extending the Closure of FSUSD Schools Through Friday, May 1, 2020

p.span: After much consideration, FSUSD is extending school closures through May 1st. As a result, the first day back for students is tentatively set for Monday, May 4th, 2020. The decision to extend school closures was not made lightly, but we believe it is in the best interest of our students, staff and community.Â Â Â

span.strong: Virtual Meeting for High School Seniors and Their Parents

p.span: We recognize school closures cause a great deal of concern, particularly for our high school seniors. The District is coordinating a special virtual meeting for high school seniors and their parents on Thursday, April 2, 2020 from 5:30 pm - 7:00 pm. More information will be provided to our senior families early next week regarding the link and directions on participating in this virtual meeting.Â
Â

Over the last two weeks, our teachers prepared to transition to a distance learning model that begins March 30th. Our buildings are closed but learning will continue. Unless previously enrolled in Google Classroom, your child should have received an invitation to join a Google Classroom.Â Â
Starting Monday, please check Google Classroom for the first set of lessons.Â
Â

Starting on Monday, March 30th, FSUSD will reduce the number of sites that distribute food to children during school closures. Reducing the number of sites will ensure that we have enough child nutrition staff to continue safely feeding children. The sites where feeding will occur starting on March 30th, 2020 are:
Fairview Elementary
Grange Middle
Suisun Elementary
Remember, any child 18 years or younger can receive a lunch and breakfast meal from these sites, Monday through Friday, between the hours of 11 am and 1 pm.

span.span: Please stay healthy. We will continue to keep you informed through Facebook, Twitter and the
https://fsusd.org.Â
School Closure operational details can be found here: www.fsusd.org/covid19

p.span: Fairfield-Suisun Unified School District (FSUSD) began feeding children ages 0-18 on Tuesday, March 17.Â Lunch and breakfast meals were distributed at five locations (Cleo Gordon Elementary, Fairfield High, Fairview Elementary, Grange Middle, and Suisun Elementary) to 734 community children on Tuesday.Â Two locations were added on Wednesday, March 18: Crystal Middle School and David A. Weir Preparatory Academy. 1,682 meals were served on Wednesday from these seven locations!

br.span: Children are provided full lunch and full breakfast meals (for the next morning) when they visit one of the sites between 11:00 AM and 1:00 PM, Monday - Friday.Â Feeding children is considered an essential function, therefore, meal distribution will continue despite the Shelter at Home order issued by Solano County.Â

p.span: Students - be sure to check your email and Google Classroom for any communications from your teachers.Â
If you have not heard directly from your teachers, below are assignments and resources you may choose to complete as a way to continue and extend your academics while school is not in session.

br.span: All Fairfield-Suisun Unified School District Families,

All schools in the Fairfield-Suisun Unified School District will be closed to students through Friday, April 17th, 2020, which was the previously scheduled final day of Spring Break. The first day back to school for students will be Monday, April 20th, 2020.

At this time, we will still be feeding ALL CHILDREN ages 18 and underÂ starting tomorrow, March 17th, 2020. However, because of the Governorâ€™s recommendation that people who are more vulnerable to COVID-19 should isolate themselves at home, we are reducing the hours and locations of feeding to keep our staff safe. Children will be able to receive food from 11:00 AM to 1:00 PM each weekday during closures from only the following schools:

p.span: Cleo Gordon Elementary - 1950 Dover Avenue, Fairfield

br.span: Fairfield High - 205 E. Atlantic Ave, Fairfield
Fairview Elementary - 830 First Street, Fairfield
Grange Middle - 1975 Blossom Ave, Fairfield
Suisun Elementary - 725 Golden Eye Way, Suisun City

p.span:
Students - be sure to check your email and Google Classroom for any communications from your teachers.
If you have not heard directly from your teachers, below are assignments and resources you may choose to complete as a way to continue and extend your academics while school is not in session.
This is a continuously changing situation. If you havenâ€™t already, please follow us through these online channels for the most up-to-date information:
Facebook - https://www.facebook.com/fsusd/

br.span: Twitter - https://twitter.com/FairfieldSuisun
Instagram - https://www.instagram.com/fsusd/
Website - https://www.fsusd.org/

p.span: Â
We will provide free meals (pickup only) for ALL children up to 18 years old starting Tuesday, March 17, from 10:00 AM to 2:00 PM every weekday that schools are closed at the following school sites!
Anna Kyle - 1600 Kidder Avenue, Fairfield

br.span: Armijo - 824 Washington St, Fairfield
Cleo Gordon - 1950 Dover Avenue, Fairfield
Crescent - 1001 Anderson Dr, Suisun City
Crystal - 400 Whispering Bay Ln, Suisun City
Dan O. Root - 820 Harrier Drive, Suisun City
David Weir - 1975 Pennsylvania Ave, Fairfield
Dover - 301 E. Alaska Ave, Fairfield
Fairfield HS - 205 E. Atlantic Ave, Fairfield
Fairview - 830 First Street, Fairfield
Grange - 1975 Blossom Ave, Fairfield
Laurel Creek - 2900 Gulf Drive, Fairfield
Mary Bird - 420 E. Tabor Ave., Fairfield
Matt Garcia - 1100 Civic Center Dr, Fairfield
Sheldon - 1901 Woolner Ave, Fairfield
Suisun El - 725 Golden Eye Way, Suisun City
Tolenas - 4500 Tolenas Rd, Fairfield

p.span: Attention Solano Families,
Â

In light of the ever-changing situation, Solano County schools will be closed for 2 weeks beginning Monday, March 16, 2020, and ending March 27, 2020. We will make a determination before March 27, 2020, about any further closures.Â

We did not take this decision lightly and recognize that this may cause a hardship for some families. Each school district and charter school will continue to communicate directly with families and staff with updates about re-opening, learning alternatives, and the availability of school meals.

School administrators across Solano County appreciate the proactive illness prevention steps that our families and staff have committed to. Illness prevention steps make a significant difference in safeguarding the health of our communities, and we encourage continued attention to this effort.
In Fairfield-Suisun Unified School District, we will:

li.span: Feed all students via food pickup services at certain sites (more detailed information will be provided later today)
Cancel or postpone ALL school connected events during this 2-week closure
Communicate with families at least once a week during the closure

p.span: Please follow us through these online channels for the most up-to-date information:

span.span: Facebook -
Twitter -
Instagram -

img.style: display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;

p.span: Dear Fairfield-Suisun Parents,

br.span: This morning, Governor Newsom announced a statewide executive order that requires non-essential large gatherings including 250 people or more to be postponed or canceled through the end of March. The Governor also pointed out that school in California is considered to be essential, so this executive order does not require schools to close.

Fairfield-Suisun schools will remain open until the State of California or the Solano County Public Health Department recommends closure. The letter linked in this message explains in more detail how most of the school districts in Solano County have decided to respond at this time.
In addition to what is stated in the letter, the Fairfield-Suisun Unified School District will:

p.span: Cancel sporting events only when it is impossible to keep the total number of people, including students participating, under 250.

br.span: Kindly ask volunteers from outside of school to refrain from participating in school activities.
Practice social distancing techniques when possible, even during regular school hours, to include avoiding the congregation of large crowds during lunch and recess.

p.span: Each individual school will communicate with parents separately about the events that will be affected by the Governorâ€™s executive order.

br.span: Thank you for your patience and understanding as we work together to lead schools through this challenging and ever-changing time.

p.span: Â
EspaÃ±ol

span.strong: FSUSD Proclama el cierre de los planteles escolares durante el aÃ±o escolar 2019-2020

span.span: Ayer, durante la reuniÃ³n de la Junta Directiva del Distrito Escolar Unificado de Fairfield-Suisun
l
a superintendente Kris Corey anunciÃ³ que FSUSD continuarÃ¡ con el aprendizaje a distancia para los estudiantes hasta el final del aÃ±o escolar 2019-2020.

p.span: â€œTenÃ­a la esperanza de que estarÃ­amos disponibles para permitir que los estudiantes regresaran a sus escuelas en persona durante la Ãºltima, o las dos Ãºltimas semanas del calendario escolar, ya que nuestro aÃ±o escolar llega a su fin el 12 de junio, un poco mÃ¡s tarde que la mayorÃ­a de otros distritos. Hubiera sido una gran oportunidad para que los estudiantes se reconectaran y celebraran algunas de las actividades escolares de fin de aÃ±o. Desafortunadamente, parece que esto no serÃ¡ posible,â€ declarÃ³ la superintendente Corey.

Las actividades de aprendizaje a distancia se han puesto en pausa, temporalmente, durante la programaciÃ³n regular de las vacaciones de primavera, del 10 de abril al 17 de abril. El aprendizaje a distancia resumirÃ¡ una vez mÃ¡s el 20 de abril. El distrito proporcionarÃ¡ informaciÃ³n adicional a su tiempo con respecto a las calificaciones y la realizaciÃ³n de los cursos.

span.span: Las ceremonias de graduaciÃ³n de preparatoria se harÃ¡n virtualmente o se pospondrÃ¡n hasta una fecha que sea seguro conducirlas en persona. Los detalles con respecto a los futuros planes de las graduaciones se les proporcionarÃ¡n segÃºn vaya cambiando la situaciÃ³n con COVID-19. La Junta Directiva aprobÃ³ algunas de las recomendaciones hechas por el personal para suspender temporalmente algunos de los requisitos de graduaciÃ³n. La informaciÃ³n sobre los requisitos de graduaciÃ³n para los seniors puede ser encontrada en la secciÃ³n de â€œNoche informativa para padres de estudiantes del cuarto aÃ±o de preparatoriaâ€ en el sitio web del distrito escolar

p.span: Los padres pueden ayudar a sus estudiantes durante estos tiempos difÃ­ciles al:

span.span: Tomar acceso de los recursos de aprendizaje en el sitio web del distrito

li.span: Tener comunicaciÃ³n cercana, positiva y colaborativa con el maestro de su hijo
Pedirle ayuda al maestro cuando la necesiten
Alentar a sus estudiantes todos los dÃ­as
Establecer una rutina y un programa regular para los estudios
Crear oportunidades para divertirse con los estudiantes mientras aprenden a travÃ©s de actividades, juegos, simples experimentos cientÃ­ficos, arte y mÃ¡s

p.span: Â

span.span: La Junta Directiva expresa inmensa apreciaciÃ³n sobre el liderazgo de la superintendente Corey, el gran trabajo del personal, y la paciencia de los padres de familia durante este tiempo. Los miembros de la junta directiva expresaron su deseo de que todos los estudiantes y los padres de familia continÃºen con su comunicaciÃ³n cercana con sus escuelas mediante comunicaciÃ³n regular con sus maestros y directores. La informaciÃ³n de contacto para los directores puede ser encontrada en el sitio web el distrito bajo el menÃº â€œNuestras escuelasâ€ en

p.span: Estimadas familias del FSUSD:

De parte de Kris Corey, Superintendente del distrito escolar unificado de Fairfield-Suisun, con un aviso importante sobre prolongaciÃ³n del cierre de las escuelas, la implementaciÃ³n del aprendizaje a distancia y la reducciÃ³n de las escuelas ofreciendo servicio de alimentos.

La Ãºltima semana ha presentado tanto retos como oportunidades. Nos ha alentado ver a tanta gente en nuestra comunidad que se ha ofrecido para liderar y ofrecerse como voluntarios.Â Apreciamos que todos se hayan unido en este momento de incertidumbre.
Al entrar en una nueva fase de cierre de escuelas durante la pandemia COVID-19, necesitamos compartir cierta informaciÃ³n importante y reciente.
Â

span.strong: Se extiende el cierre de las escuelas de la FSUSD hasta el viernes 1 de mayo de 2020.

p.span: DespuÃ©s de mucha consideraciÃ³n, el Distrito Escolar Unificado de Fairfield-Suisun estÃ¡ extendiendo el cierre de las escuelas hasta el 1 de mayo. Como resultado, el primer dÃ­a de regreso para los estudiantes estÃ¡ fijado provisionalmente para el lunes 4 de mayo del 2020. La decisiÃ³n de extender el cierre de las escuelas no fue fÃ¡cil, pero creemos que es en el mejor interÃ©s de nuestros estudiantes, personal y comunidad.Â
Â

span.strong: Una reuniÃ³n virtual para los estudiantes de Ãºltimo aÃ±o de preparatoria y sus padres.

p.span: Reconocemos que el cierre de escuelas causa mucha preocupaciÃ³n, particularmente para nuestros estudiantes de Ãºltimo aÃ±o de la preparatoria. El Distrito estÃ¡ coordinando una sesiÃ³n virtual especial para los estudiantes de Ãºltimo aÃ±o y sus padres el jueves 2 de abril de 2020 de 5:30 pm a 7:00 pm. A principios de la semana prÃ³xima se proporcionarÃ¡ mÃ¡s informaciÃ³n a nuestras familias de los estudiantes de Ãºltimo aÃ±o sobre el enlace y las indicaciones para participar en esta reuniÃ³n virtual.Â
Â

span.span: Durante las Ãºltimas dos semanas, nuestros docentes se prepararon para la transiciÃ³n a un modelo de aprendizaje a distancia que comienza el 30 de marzo. Nuestras instalaciones estÃ¡n cerradas, pero el aprendizaje continuarÃ¡. A menos que se haya inscrito previamente en la aplicaciÃ³n de
, su hijo deberÃ­a haber recibido una invitaciÃ³n para unirse a
.Â Â

p.span: A partir del lunes, por favor revise la aplicaciÃ³n de Google Classroom para las primeras series de cursos.Â
Â

span.strong: Servicio de alimentos durante el cierre de las escuelas

p.span: Comenzando el lunes 30 de marzo, FSUSD reducirÃ¡ el nÃºmero de lugares que distribuyen alimentos a los niÃ±os durante el cierre de escuelas. Reduciendo el nÃºmero de lugares asegurarÃ¡ que tengamos el personal suficiente del departamento de nutriciÃ³n para continuar alimentando a los niÃ±os de manera segura. Los sitios donde la alimentaciÃ³n se llevarÃ¡ a cabo a partir del 30 de marzo de 2020 son:
Â
La Primaria Fairview
La secundaria de Grange

Recuerde, cualquier niÃ±o de 18 aÃ±os o menor puede recibir un almuerzo y un desayuno en estas escuelas, de lunes a viernes, entre las 11 de la maÃ±ana y la 1 de la tarde.
Por favor, mantÃ©ngase en buena salud. Seguiremos manteniÃ©ndolos al tanto a travÃ©s de Facebook, Twitter y la pÃ¡gina web FSUSD.org.
Dear Fairfield-Suisun Unified Parents and Guardians,Â

The health and safety of our students and staff are a top priority. The Fairfield-Suisun Unified School District continues to work with the Solano County Public Health Department and the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) regarding the 2019 Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19).Â

The CDC held a press conference this morning, stating that of the 70,000 cases studied in China, 80% experienced mild symptoms and only 2% of the 70,000 were under the age of 19. While scientific research shows that children are resistant to COVID-19, families should continue to practice healthy habits to protect those who are more susceptible to this disease. We encourage everyone to frequently wash their hands, cover their nose and mouth when sneezing and coughing, refrain from touching their hands to their faces, and stay home if they have flu or cold symptoms. Those who have flu or cold symptoms should seek advice directly from their doctor by phone from home before seeking care in person.

The Solano County Public Health Department continues to encourage us to keep schools open at this time. Closing schools will not significantly slow the spread of COVID-19 because students will still be exposed to public spaces, but closing schools could have a significant, negative impact on families in other ways.

span.span: We understand the Novel Coronavirus is causing concern for many parents. We are committed to empowering families to help keep themselves and their community healthy by sharing the best information at the most effective time. Together, we can take the actions necessary to thrive through this challenging time.

p.span: We will continue to provide further updates from the CDC and Solano Public Health. If you have any questions or concerns, please speak with your school principal.Â
Â

a.span: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

p.span: Â
Thank you,
Fairfield-Suisun Unified School District
Hello parents and families,

span.span: Attached is a letter from Solano County Public Health regarding the Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) that they have asked us to distribute to FSUSD families. Healthy practices to continue doing as individuals and families, and insight into potential school closures are included in the letter. We encourage you to read the letter and visit

p.span: We are grateful for our partnership with Solano County Public Health and look forward to passing on further updates from their organization regarding this evolving situation.

span.a: Letter from Solano County Public Health

p.span: The health and safety of our students and staff are a top priority.Â The Fairfield-Suisun Unified School District has been notified by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) to urge school sites to prepare for a possible outbreak of the 2019 Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19). For the past number of weeks, the district has been working closely with Solano County Public Health to ensure student and staff safety.Â

Last night, the CDC confirmed the first case of Novel Coronavirus in Solano County. While this may be alarming and cause fear, we want to assure you that FSUSD is taking precautions to keep our school sites disinfected and clean. Our staff will wipe down commonly shared surfaces every day with disinfectants.
Students and staff are encouraged to frequently wash their hands, cover their nose and mouth when sneezing and coughing, and stay home if they are sick.Â

We understand the Novel Coronavirus is causing concern for many of our parents. Please keep in mind that this is a virus, and it is not specific to any single race or ethnicity. It is important to speak with your children about cultural sensitivity during this challenging time.
We will continue to provide further updates from the CDC and Solano Public Health. If you have any questions or concerns, please speak with your school principal.Â
Â

a.span: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

p.span: Â
Thank you,
Fairfield-Suisun Unified School District

El Distrito Escolar Unificado de Fairfield-Suisun (FSUSD) comenzÃ³ con la alimentaciÃ³n de los niÃ±os de 0 a 18 aÃ±os el martes 17 de marzo.Â Se distribuyeron almuerzos y desayunos en cinco escuelas (Cleo Gordon Elementary, Fairfield High, Fairview Elementary, Grange Middle, y Suisun Elementary) a 734 niÃ±os de la comunidad el martes.Â El miÃ©rcoles 18 de marzo se aÃ±adieron dos nuevas escuelas: la Escuela Secundaria Crystal y la Academia de PreparaciÃ³n David A. Weir. 1.682 comidas fueron servidas el miÃ©rcoles desde estas siete escuelas.

br.span: Los niÃ±os reciben un almuerzo completo y un desayuno completo (para el dÃ­a siguiente) cuando visitan uno de los sitios entre las 11:00 AM y la 1:00 PM, de lunes a viernes.Â Alimentar a los niÃ±os se considera una funciÃ³n esencial, por lo tanto, la distribuciÃ³n de comidas continuarÃ¡ a pesar de la orden de permanecer en casa "Shelter in Place" emitida por el condado de Solano.

Para todas las familias del Distrito Escolar Unificado de Fairfield-Suisun
Este es un mensaje de Tim Goree, director ejecutivo de servicios administrativos y de la participaciÃ³n comunitaria, sobre noticias importantes acerca del cierre de las escuelas.

Todas las escuelas del Distrito Escolar de Fairfield-Suisun estarÃ¡n cerradas para los estudiantes hasta el viernes, 17 de abril, 2020, la fecha previamente programada para el Ãºltimo dÃ­a de las vacaciones de primavera (Spring Break). El primer dÃ­a de regreso a clases para los estudiantes serÃ¡ el lunes, 20 de abril, 2020.Â Â

Por el momento, estaremos alimentando a los estudiantes comenzando maÃ±ana, 17 de marzo, 2020. Sin embargo, dada la recomendaciÃ³n del gobernador de que las personas quienes son mÃ¡s vulnerables al COVID-19 deberÃ­an aislarse en casa, reduciremos las horas y ubicaciones de alimentaciÃ³n para mantener a nuestro personal seguro. Los niÃ±os podrÃ¡n recibir alimentos de las 11:00 AM a la 1:00 PM cada semana durante el cierre solamente de las siguientes escuelas:
Primaria Cleo Gordon - 1950 Dover Avenue, Fairfield

br.span: Preparatoria Fairfield - 205 E. Atlantic Ave, Fairfield

p.span: AtenciÃ³n Familias de Solano,
Â

Debido a las siempre cambiantes circunstancias, las escuelas del condado de Solano cerrarÃ¡n durante dos semanas, comenzando el lunes 16 de marzo de 2020 hasta el 27 de marzo de 2020. Tomaremos una decisiÃ³n antes del 27 de marzo de 2020, sobre futuros cierres.Â

No tomamos esta decisiÃ³n a la ligera y reconocemos que esto puede causar dificultades para algunas familias. Cada distrito escolar y escuela chÃ¡rter continuarÃ¡ comunicÃ¡ndose directamente con las familias y el personal con informes al respecto de la reapertura, alternativas de enseÃ±anza y la disponibilidad de alimentos en la escuela.

Los administradores de las escuelas a travÃ©s del Condado de Solano agradecen los pasos proactivos de prevenciÃ³n a las enfermedades con los cuales nuestras familias y personal se han comprometido. Los pasos para prevenir enfermedades hacen una diferencia significativa en la salvaguarda de la salud de nuestras comunidades, y alentamos la atenciÃ³n continua a este esfuerzo.
Lo que haremos en el Distrito Escolar Unificado Fairfield-Suisun:

li.span: Alimentaremos a todos los estudiantes a travÃ©s de los servicios de entrega de alimentos en determinados lugares (mÃ¡s informaciÃ³n detallada serÃ¡ proporcionada mÃ¡s adelante el dÃ­a de hoy)
Cancelar o posponer TODOS los eventos escolares durante estas dos semanas de cierre.
Comunicarnos con las familias al menos una vez a la semana durante el cierre

p.span: Por favor, sÃ­ganos a travÃ©s de estos medios en lÃ­nea para obtener la informaciÃ³n mÃ¡s reciente:

p.span: Estimados padres de Fairfield-Suisun,

Esta maÃ±ana, el gobernador Newsom dio la orden ejecutiva para todo el estado de California la cual requiere que las reuniones/asambleas/eventos no esenciales que incluyan a 250 personas o mÃ¡s, sean postergados o cancelados hasta finales de marzo. El gobernador tambiÃ©n indicÃ³ que la escuela en el estado de California es considerada esencial, por lo tanto, esta orden ejecutiva no requiere que las escuelas cierren.

Las escuelas de Fairfield-Suisun continuarÃ¡n abiertas hasta que el estado de California o el Departamento de Salud PÃºblica del Condado de Solano recomiende cerrarlas. La carta adjunta a este mensaje explica con mÃ¡s detalle la manera en la que la mayorÃ­a de los distritos escolares en el condado de Solano han decidiÃ³ responder durante este tiempo.

span.a: Por favor lea cuidadosamente la carta adjunta.

p.span: En adiciÃ³n a lo que se ha indicado en la carta, el distrito escolar de Fairfield Suisun harÃ¡ lo siguiente:
Cancelaremos los eventos de deportes solo cuando sea imposible mantener el nÃºmero de personas bajo 250, incluyendo a los estudiantes participando.

br.span: Amablemente pediremos a los voluntarios fuera de la escuela que eviten participar en las actividades escolares.

Practicaremos tÃ©cnicas de distancia social cuando sea posible, incluso durante el horario regular de clases, para incluir evitar la congregaciÃ³n de grupos grandes durante los recesos y el receso de almuerzo.
Cada escuela se comunicarÃ¡ individualmente con los padres de familia para darles informaciÃ³n sobre los eventos que se verÃ¡n afectados por la orden ejecutiva del gobernador.Â

p.span: Gracias por su paciencia y comprensiÃ³n mientras trabajamos juntos para guiar a las escuelas durante estos tiempos difÃ­ciles y de cambios continuos.
Estimados padres y tutores del Distrito Unificado de Fairfield-Suisun,Â

La salud y la seguridad de nuestros estudiantes y personal son una mayor prioridad. El Distrito Escolar Unificado de Fairfield-Suisun continÃºa trabajando con el Departamento de Salud PÃºblica del Condado de Solano y los Centros para el Control y la PrevenciÃ³n de Enfermedades (CDC) en cuanto al 2019 Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19).

El CDC dio una rueda de prensa esta maÃ±ana, declarando que de los 70.000 casos estudiados en China, el 80% presentÃ³ sÃ­ntomas leves y sÃ³lo el 2% de los 70.000 eran menores de 19 aÃ±os. Aunque los estudios cientÃ­ficos demuestran que los niÃ±os son resistentes a COVID-19, las familias deben continuar practicando hÃ¡bitos saludables para proteger a los que son mÃ¡s susceptibles a esta enfermedad. Alentamos a todos que se laven las manos frecuentemente, se cubran la nariz y la boca al estornudar y toser, se limiten de tocarse la cara con las manos y a permanecer en casa si presentan sÃ­ntomas de gripe, o resfriado/catarro. Quienes presenten un cuadro gripal o sÃ­ntomas de resfriado deberÃ­an llamar por telÃ©fono directamente a su mÃ©dico desde su casa antes de ir en persona a buscar atenciÃ³n mÃ©dica.

El Departamento de Salud PÃºblica del Condado de Solano continÃºa recomendÃ¡ndonos que mantengamos las escuelas abiertas en este momento. El cierre de las escuelas no reducirÃ¡ significativamente la propagaciÃ³n de COVID-19 porque los estudiantes seguirÃ¡n expuestos a los espacios pÃºblicos, pero el cierre de las escuelas puede tener un impacto negativo significativo en las familias de otras maneras.

span.span: Entendemos que el nuevo Coronavirus estÃ¡ causando preocupaciÃ³n para muchos padres. Estamos comprometidos a capacitar a las familias con el fin de ayudarles a mantenerse a sÃ­ mismos y a su comunidad en buen estado de salud, compartiendo la mejor informaciÃ³n en el momento mÃ¡s efectivo. Juntos, podemos tomar las medidas necesarias para prosperar en este momento tan difÃ­cil.

p.span: Continuaremos proporcionando mÃ¡s informes del CDC y del Departamento de Salud PÃºblica de Solano. Si tienen alguna pregunta o preocupaciÃ³n, por favor hablen con el director(a) de su escuela.

span.span: Adjunto podrÃ¡n encontrar una carta proporcionada por el Centro de Salud PÃºblica del Condado de Solano con respecto a la enfermedad Coronavirus 2019 (COVID-19) y nos han pedido compartirla con nuestras familias de FSUSD. p.span: Estamos agradecidos con nuestra asociaciÃ³n con el Centro de Salud PÃºblica del Condado de Solano y continuaremos actualizandolos con nueva informaciÃ³n proporcionada por la organizaciÃ³n con respecto a la evoluciÃ³n de la situaciÃ³n.

span.a: Carta del Centro de Salud PÃºblica del Condado de Solano

p.span: La salud y seguridad de nuestros estudiantes y personal son nuestra mayor prioridad. Los Centros de Control y la PrevenciÃ³n de Enfermedades (CDC, por sus siglas en inglÃ©s) ha notificado al Distrito Escolar Unificado de Fairfield Suisun a urgir a los planteles escolares a que estÃ©n preparados para un posible brote del Nuevo Coronavirus 2019 (2019-nCoV). El distrito ha trabajado de cerca con el Departamento de Salud PÃºblica del Condado de Solano en las Ãºltimas semanas para asegurarnos de mantener a los estudiantes y el personal seguros.

Anoche, CDC confirmÃ³ el primer caso del Nuevo Coronavirus en el condado de Solano. Mientras esto sea alarmante y cause temor, queremos asegurarles que FSUSD estÃ¡ tomando precauciones para mantener nuestros planteles desinfectados y limpios. Nuestro personal limpiara y desinfectara las superficies que son compartidas todos los dÃ­as.
Se les alienta a los estudiantes y al personal lavarse las manos con frecuencia, cubrir su boca y nariz cuando estornude o tosa, y permanecer en sus hogares si estÃ¡n enfermos.

Comprendemos que el Nuevo Coronavirus ha ocasionado preocupaciÃ³n a muchos de nuestros padres de familia. Por favor, mantengan en mente que este es un virus, y no es especÃ­fico a ninguna raza o etnicidad. Es importante que hablen con sus hijos sobre la sensibilidad cultural durante estos tiempos difÃ­ciles.

Continuaremos compartiendo mÃ¡s noticias proporcionadas por CDC y del Departamento de Salud PÃºblica de Solano con ustedes. Si tiene alguna pregunta o preocupaciÃ³n, por favor hable con el director(a) de su escuela.
